SENTENCE.STRING: (baptized as Johannes Chrysostomus Wolfgangus Theophilus Mozart; January 27, 1756 - December 5, 1791) was a prolific and highly influential composer of Classical music.
enormous output of more than six hundred compositions includes works that are widely acknowledged as pinnacles of symphonic, chamber, piano, operatic, and choral music.
is among the most enduringly popular of European composers, and many of
works are part of the standard concert repertoire.
